channel.title: PI armour level requirments

item.title: PI armour level requirments
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

I actually made a tutorial a long time a ago on doing item requirements externally

Read full topic

item.title: PI armour level requirments
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

DAn0194:

Lol Calm down. I load stuff externally when it is correct. Do you how stupid it is to make an enum that holds every equipment in there, it doesn’t make any sense. Next tutorial ill make something with an enum if it makes you happy.

If you would have read what that enum is for, you’d understand it’s appropriate. The entire point of it was to check if you’re wearing a set-item or not. You know, for added bonuses and such?

Clawz fury:

he’s right though, it should be loaded externally. if you’re going to help someone you wanna give them the best solution right?

What I suggested was a solution to get things working for now. When there’s a “major” (I put quotes because level requirements isn’t considered major to all) bug you can put in a temporary solution, like what I said, until you understand how to add in the best solution, which would be loading from json or similar, as you said claws (and dan as well).

Read full topic

item.title: PI armour level requirments
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:17, topic:538043”][quote author=DAn0194 link=topic=656869.msg4395434#msg4395434 date=1388969456]

Why does everyone ask that, “am I putting it in the right place”. It’s like no one knows that you could literally add any method to any class.
If you wanted to (while it would be inappropriate since this class isn’t for items) you could put your code in your chat packet. You can put code anywhere you please and it’d be okay. It’s frowned upon is because that is the worst possibly organization you could possibly do, and it may not be read correctly, but it could still be done.

So, to answer your question. Technically, yes, any class is the right spot.

However, I’d suggest looking into rewriting how your server handles item requirements…

I found a tutorial a long while back on making a different equipment check instead of the original one in PI, I’m sure with 2 minutes of work, you could add some form of stat requirement, or you could make a mock-up of this class and make it for level checks instead of just what you’re wearing.

[code=java]package server.model.players.equipment;

import server.model.players.Client;

public class CheckEquipment {

public final Client c;

public CheckEquipment(final Client Client) {
	c = Client;
}

public enum EquipmentData {
	ARHIMS_FULL(4716, 4720, 4722, 4718, -1, -1, -1),
	ARHIMS_100(4856, 4868, 4874, 4862, -1, -1, -1),
	ARHIMS_75(4857, 4869, 4875, 4863, -1, -1, -1),
	ARHIMS_50(4858, 4870, 4876, 4864, -1, -1, -1),
	ARHIMS_25(4859, 4871, 4877, 4865, -1, -1, -1),
	ARHIMS_0(4860, 4872, 4878, 4866, -1, -1, -1),

	DHAROKS_FULL(4708, 4712, 4714, 4710, -1, -1, -1),
	DHAROKS_100(4880, 4892, 4898, 4886, -1, -1, -1),
	DHAROKS_75(4881, 4893, 4899, 4887, -1, -1, -1),
	DHAROKS_50(4882, 4894, 4900, 4888, -1, -1, -1),
	DHAROKS_25(4883, 4895, 4901, 4889, -1, -1, -1),
	DHAROKS_0(4884, 4896, 4902, 4890, -1, -1, -1),
	
	GUTHANS_FULL(4724, 4728, 4730, 4726, -1, -1, -1),
	GUTHANS_100(4904, 4728, 4730, 4726, -1, -1, -1),
	GUTHANS_75(4905, 4916, 4922, 4910, -1, -1, -1),
	GUTHANS_50(4906, 4917, 4923, 4911, -1, -1, -1),
	GUTHANS_25(4907, 4918, 4924, 4912, -1, -1, -1),
	GUTHANS_0(4908, 4919, 4925, 4913, -1, -1, -1),
	
	KARILS_FULL(4732, 4736, 4738, 4734, -1, -1, -1),
	KARILS_100(4928, 4940, 4946, 4934, -1, -1, -1),
	KARILS_75(4929, 4941, 4947, 4935, -1, -1, -1),
	KARILS_50(4930, 4942, 4948, 4936, -1, -1, -1),
	KARILS_25(4931, 4943, 4949, 4937, -1, -1, -1),
	KARILS_0(4932, 4944, 4950, 4938, -1, -1, -1),
	
	TORAGS_FULL(4745, 4749, 4751, 4747, -1, -1, -1),
	TORAGS_100(4952, 4964, 4970, 4958, -1, -1, -1),
	TORAGS_75(4953, 4965, 4971, 4959, -1, -1, -1),
	TORAGS_50(4954, 4966, 4972, 4960, -1, -1, -1),
	TORAGS_25(4955, 4967, 4973, 4961, -1, -1, -1),
	TORAGS_0(4956, 4968, 4974, 4962, -1, -1, -1),
	
	VERACS_FULL(4753, 4757, 4759, 4755, -1, -1, -1),
	VERACS_100(4982, 4988, 4994, 4988, -1, -1, -1),
	VERACS_75(4983, 4989, 4995, 4989, -1, -1, -1),
	VERACS_50(4984, 4990, 4996, 4990, -1, -1, -1),
	VERACS_25(4985, 4991, 4997, 4991, -1, -1, -1),
	VERACS_0(4986, 4992, 4998, 4992, -1, -1, -1),
	
	VOID_MELEE(11665, 8839, 8840, -1, -1, 8842, -1),
	VOID_RANGE(11664, 8839, 8840, -1, -1, 8842, -1),
	VOID_MAGE(11663, 8839, 8840, -1, -1, 8842, -1)
	;

	private int helmId, bodyId, legId, weaponId, shieldId, handId, footId;
	
	private EquipmentData(int helmId, int bodyId, int legId, int weaponId, int shieldId, int handId, int footId) {
		this.helmId = helmId;
		this.bodyId = bodyId;
		this.legId = legId;
		this.weaponId = weaponId;
		this.shieldId = shieldId;
		this.handId = handId;
		this.footId = footId;
	}
	
	public int getHelm(int helm) {
		return helmId;
	}

	public int getBody(int body) {
		return bodyId;
	}

	public int getLegs(int leg) {
		return legId;
	}

	public int getWeapon(int weapon) {
		return weaponId;
	}
	
	public int getShield(int shield) {
		return shieldId;
	}
	public int getHand(int hand) {
		return handId;
	}
	public int getBoot(int boot) {
		return footId;
	}

/Checking for equipment, includes Full, Body, Legs, Helm, Weapon, and if not -1, Shield/
public static boolean checkFullEquipment(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(checkHelm(c, equip) && checkBody(c, equip) && checkLegs(c, equip) && checkWeapon(c, equip) &&
checkShield(c, equip) && checkHands(c, equip) && checkBoots(c, equip))
return true;
else
return false;
}
public static boolean checkHelm(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(equip.getHelm(c.playerEquipment[c.playerHat]) == -1 ||
(c.playerEquipment[c.playerHat] == equip.getHelm(c.playerEquipment[c.playerHat]))) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
public static boolean checkBody(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(equip.getBody(c.playerEquipment[c.playerChest]) == -1 ||
(c.playerEquipment[c.playerChest] == equip.getBody(c.playerEquipment[c.playerChest]))) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
public static boolean checkLegs(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(equip.getLegs(c.playerEquipment[c.playerLegs]) == -1 ||
(c.playerEquipment[c.playerLegs] == equip.getLegs(c.playerEquipment[c.playerLegs]))) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
public static boolean checkWeapon(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(equip.getWeapon(c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon]) == -1 ||
(c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon] == equip.getWeapon(c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon]))) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
public static boolean checkShield(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(equip.getShield(c.playerEquipment[c.playerShield]) == -1 ||
(c.playerEquipment[c.playerShield] == equip.getShield(c.playerEquipment[c.playerShield]))) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
public static boolean checkBoots(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(equip.getBoot(c.playerEquipment[c.playerFeet]) == -1 ||
(c.playerEquipment[c.playerFeet] == equip.getBoot(c.playerEquipment[c.playerFeet]))) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
public static boolean checkHands(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(c.playerEquipment[c.playerHands] == equip.getHand(c.playerEquipment[c.playerHands])) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
}
}[/code]

The only code that is mine is I added some of the enums, and modified it to support all wear slots (I think).
Source: http://goo.gl/SDLjVPl (R-S seems to be down at the moment, sorry)

You should not be handling this with an enum. Load it externally.
[/quote]
I don’t care how it should be done. How about you go write a god damn tutorial on how to load EVERYTHING EXTERNALLY since that’s all you bitch about.[/quote]
Lol Calm down. I load stuff externally when it is correct. Do you how stupid it is to make an enum that holds every equipment in there, it doesn’t make any sense. Next tutorial ill make something with an enum if it makes you happy.

Read full topic

item.title: PI armour level requirments
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:17, topic:538043”][quote author=DAn0194 link=topic=656869.msg4395434#msg4395434 date=1388969456]

Why does everyone ask that, “am I putting it in the right place”. It’s like no one knows that you could literally add any method to any class.
If you wanted to (while it would be inappropriate since this class isn’t for items) you could put your code in your chat packet. You can put code anywhere you please and it’d be okay. It’s frowned upon is because that is the worst possibly organization you could possibly do, and it may not be read correctly, but it could still be done.

So, to answer your question. Technically, yes, any class is the right spot.

However, I’d suggest looking into rewriting how your server handles item requirements…

I found a tutorial a long while back on making a different equipment check instead of the original one in PI, I’m sure with 2 minutes of work, you could add some form of stat requirement, or you could make a mock-up of this class and make it for level checks instead of just what you’re wearing.

[code=java]package server.model.players.equipment;

import server.model.players.Client;

public class CheckEquipment {

public final Client c;

public CheckEquipment(final Client Client) {
	c = Client;
}

public enum EquipmentData {
	ARHIMS_FULL(4716, 4720, 4722, 4718, -1, -1, -1),
	ARHIMS_100(4856, 4868, 4874, 4862, -1, -1, -1),
	ARHIMS_75(4857, 4869, 4875, 4863, -1, -1, -1),
	ARHIMS_50(4858, 4870, 4876, 4864, -1, -1, -1),
	ARHIMS_25(4859, 4871, 4877, 4865, -1, -1, -1),
	ARHIMS_0(4860, 4872, 4878, 4866, -1, -1, -1),

	DHAROKS_FULL(4708, 4712, 4714, 4710, -1, -1, -1),
	DHAROKS_100(4880, 4892, 4898, 4886, -1, -1, -1),
	DHAROKS_75(4881, 4893, 4899, 4887, -1, -1, -1),
	DHAROKS_50(4882, 4894, 4900, 4888, -1, -1, -1),
	DHAROKS_25(4883, 4895, 4901, 4889, -1, -1, -1),
	DHAROKS_0(4884, 4896, 4902, 4890, -1, -1, -1),
	
	GUTHANS_FULL(4724, 4728, 4730, 4726, -1, -1, -1),
	GUTHANS_100(4904, 4728, 4730, 4726, -1, -1, -1),
	GUTHANS_75(4905, 4916, 4922, 4910, -1, -1, -1),
	GUTHANS_50(4906, 4917, 4923, 4911, -1, -1, -1),
	GUTHANS_25(4907, 4918, 4924, 4912, -1, -1, -1),
	GUTHANS_0(4908, 4919, 4925, 4913, -1, -1, -1),
	
	KARILS_FULL(4732, 4736, 4738, 4734, -1, -1, -1),
	KARILS_100(4928, 4940, 4946, 4934, -1, -1, -1),
	KARILS_75(4929, 4941, 4947, 4935, -1, -1, -1),
	KARILS_50(4930, 4942, 4948, 4936, -1, -1, -1),
	KARILS_25(4931, 4943, 4949, 4937, -1, -1, -1),
	KARILS_0(4932, 4944, 4950, 4938, -1, -1, -1),
	
	TORAGS_FULL(4745, 4749, 4751, 4747, -1, -1, -1),
	TORAGS_100(4952, 4964, 4970, 4958, -1, -1, -1),
	TORAGS_75(4953, 4965, 4971, 4959, -1, -1, -1),
	TORAGS_50(4954, 4966, 4972, 4960, -1, -1, -1),
	TORAGS_25(4955, 4967, 4973, 4961, -1, -1, -1),
	TORAGS_0(4956, 4968, 4974, 4962, -1, -1, -1),
	
	VERACS_FULL(4753, 4757, 4759, 4755, -1, -1, -1),
	VERACS_100(4982, 4988, 4994, 4988, -1, -1, -1),
	VERACS_75(4983, 4989, 4995, 4989, -1, -1, -1),
	VERACS_50(4984, 4990, 4996, 4990, -1, -1, -1),
	VERACS_25(4985, 4991, 4997, 4991, -1, -1, -1),
	VERACS_0(4986, 4992, 4998, 4992, -1, -1, -1),
	
	VOID_MELEE(11665, 8839, 8840, -1, -1, 8842, -1),
	VOID_RANGE(11664, 8839, 8840, -1, -1, 8842, -1),
	VOID_MAGE(11663, 8839, 8840, -1, -1, 8842, -1)
	;

	private int helmId, bodyId, legId, weaponId, shieldId, handId, footId;
	
	private EquipmentData(int helmId, int bodyId, int legId, int weaponId, int shieldId, int handId, int footId) {
		this.helmId = helmId;
		this.bodyId = bodyId;
		this.legId = legId;
		this.weaponId = weaponId;
		this.shieldId = shieldId;
		this.handId = handId;
		this.footId = footId;
	}
	
	public int getHelm(int helm) {
		return helmId;
	}

	public int getBody(int body) {
		return bodyId;
	}

	public int getLegs(int leg) {
		return legId;
	}

	public int getWeapon(int weapon) {
		return weaponId;
	}
	
	public int getShield(int shield) {
		return shieldId;
	}
	public int getHand(int hand) {
		return handId;
	}
	public int getBoot(int boot) {
		return footId;
	}

/Checking for equipment, includes Full, Body, Legs, Helm, Weapon, and if not -1, Shield/
public static boolean checkFullEquipment(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(checkHelm(c, equip) && checkBody(c, equip) && checkLegs(c, equip) && checkWeapon(c, equip) &&
checkShield(c, equip) && checkHands(c, equip) && checkBoots(c, equip))
return true;
else
return false;
}
public static boolean checkHelm(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(equip.getHelm(c.playerEquipment[c.playerHat]) == -1 ||
(c.playerEquipment[c.playerHat] == equip.getHelm(c.playerEquipment[c.playerHat]))) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
public static boolean checkBody(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(equip.getBody(c.playerEquipment[c.playerChest]) == -1 ||
(c.playerEquipment[c.playerChest] == equip.getBody(c.playerEquipment[c.playerChest]))) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
public static boolean checkLegs(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(equip.getLegs(c.playerEquipment[c.playerLegs]) == -1 ||
(c.playerEquipment[c.playerLegs] == equip.getLegs(c.playerEquipment[c.playerLegs]))) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
public static boolean checkWeapon(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(equip.getWeapon(c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon]) == -1 ||
(c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon] == equip.getWeapon(c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon]))) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
public static boolean checkShield(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(equip.getShield(c.playerEquipment[c.playerShield]) == -1 ||
(c.playerEquipment[c.playerShield] == equip.getShield(c.playerEquipment[c.playerShield]))) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
public static boolean checkBoots(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(equip.getBoot(c.playerEquipment[c.playerFeet]) == -1 ||
(c.playerEquipment[c.playerFeet] == equip.getBoot(c.playerEquipment[c.playerFeet]))) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
public static boolean checkHands(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(c.playerEquipment[c.playerHands] == equip.getHand(c.playerEquipment[c.playerHands])) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
}
}[/code]

The only code that is mine is I added some of the enums, and modified it to support all wear slots (I think).
Source: http://goo.gl/SDLjVPl (R-S seems to be down at the moment, sorry)

You should not be handling this with an enum. Load it externally.
[/quote]
I don’t care how it should be done. How about you go write a god damn tutorial on how to load EVERYTHING EXTERNALLY since that’s all you bitch about.[/quote]
he’s right though, it should be loaded externally. if you’re going to help someone you wanna give them the best solution right?

item.title: PI armour level requirments
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“DAn0194, post:16, topic:538043”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=656869.msg4395407#msg4395407 date=1388963100]
Why does everyone ask that, “am I putting it in the right place”. It’s like no one knows that you could literally add any method to any class.
If you wanted to (while it would be inappropriate since this class isn’t for items) you could put your code in your chat packet. You can put code anywhere you please and it’d be okay. It’s frowned upon is because that is the worst possibly organization you could possibly do, and it may not be read correctly, but it could still be done.

So, to answer your question. Technically, yes, any class is the right spot.

However, I’d suggest looking into rewriting how your server handles item requirements…

I found a tutorial a long while back on making a different equipment check instead of the original one in PI, I’m sure with 2 minutes of work, you could add some form of stat requirement, or you could make a mock-up of this class and make it for level checks instead of just what you’re wearing.

[code=java]package server.model.players.equipment;

import server.model.players.Client;

public class CheckEquipment {

public final Client c;

public CheckEquipment(final Client Client) {
	c = Client;
}

public enum EquipmentData {
	ARHIMS_FULL(4716, 4720, 4722, 4718, -1, -1, -1),
	ARHIMS_100(4856, 4868, 4874, 4862, -1, -1, -1),
	ARHIMS_75(4857, 4869, 4875, 4863, -1, -1, -1),
	ARHIMS_50(4858, 4870, 4876, 4864, -1, -1, -1),
	ARHIMS_25(4859, 4871, 4877, 4865, -1, -1, -1),
	ARHIMS_0(4860, 4872, 4878, 4866, -1, -1, -1),

	DHAROKS_FULL(4708, 4712, 4714, 4710, -1, -1, -1),
	DHAROKS_100(4880, 4892, 4898, 4886, -1, -1, -1),
	DHAROKS_75(4881, 4893, 4899, 4887, -1, -1, -1),
	DHAROKS_50(4882, 4894, 4900, 4888, -1, -1, -1),
	DHAROKS_25(4883, 4895, 4901, 4889, -1, -1, -1),
	DHAROKS_0(4884, 4896, 4902, 4890, -1, -1, -1),
	
	GUTHANS_FULL(4724, 4728, 4730, 4726, -1, -1, -1),
	GUTHANS_100(4904, 4728, 4730, 4726, -1, -1, -1),
	GUTHANS_75(4905, 4916, 4922, 4910, -1, -1, -1),
	GUTHANS_50(4906, 4917, 4923, 4911, -1, -1, -1),
	GUTHANS_25(4907, 4918, 4924, 4912, -1, -1, -1),
	GUTHANS_0(4908, 4919, 4925, 4913, -1, -1, -1),
	
	KARILS_FULL(4732, 4736, 4738, 4734, -1, -1, -1),
	KARILS_100(4928, 4940, 4946, 4934, -1, -1, -1),
	KARILS_75(4929, 4941, 4947, 4935, -1, -1, -1),
	KARILS_50(4930, 4942, 4948, 4936, -1, -1, -1),
	KARILS_25(4931, 4943, 4949, 4937, -1, -1, -1),
	KARILS_0(4932, 4944, 4950, 4938, -1, -1, -1),
	
	TORAGS_FULL(4745, 4749, 4751, 4747, -1, -1, -1),
	TORAGS_100(4952, 4964, 4970, 4958, -1, -1, -1),
	TORAGS_75(4953, 4965, 4971, 4959, -1, -1, -1),
	TORAGS_50(4954, 4966, 4972, 4960, -1, -1, -1),
	TORAGS_25(4955, 4967, 4973, 4961, -1, -1, -1),
	TORAGS_0(4956, 4968, 4974, 4962, -1, -1, -1),
	
	VERACS_FULL(4753, 4757, 4759, 4755, -1, -1, -1),
	VERACS_100(4982, 4988, 4994, 4988, -1, -1, -1),
	VERACS_75(4983, 4989, 4995, 4989, -1, -1, -1),
	VERACS_50(4984, 4990, 4996, 4990, -1, -1, -1),
	VERACS_25(4985, 4991, 4997, 4991, -1, -1, -1),
	VERACS_0(4986, 4992, 4998, 4992, -1, -1, -1),
	
	VOID_MELEE(11665, 8839, 8840, -1, -1, 8842, -1),
	VOID_RANGE(11664, 8839, 8840, -1, -1, 8842, -1),
	VOID_MAGE(11663, 8839, 8840, -1, -1, 8842, -1)
	;

	private int helmId, bodyId, legId, weaponId, shieldId, handId, footId;
	
	private EquipmentData(int helmId, int bodyId, int legId, int weaponId, int shieldId, int handId, int footId) {
		this.helmId = helmId;
		this.bodyId = bodyId;
		this.legId = legId;
		this.weaponId = weaponId;
		this.shieldId = shieldId;
		this.handId = handId;
		this.footId = footId;
	}
	
	public int getHelm(int helm) {
		return helmId;
	}

	public int getBody(int body) {
		return bodyId;
	}

	public int getLegs(int leg) {
		return legId;
	}

	public int getWeapon(int weapon) {
		return weaponId;
	}
	
	public int getShield(int shield) {
		return shieldId;
	}
	public int getHand(int hand) {
		return handId;
	}
	public int getBoot(int boot) {
		return footId;
	}

/Checking for equipment, includes Full, Body, Legs, Helm, Weapon, and if not -1, Shield/
public static boolean checkFullEquipment(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(checkHelm(c, equip) && checkBody(c, equip) && checkLegs(c, equip) && checkWeapon(c, equip) &&
checkShield(c, equip) && checkHands(c, equip) && checkBoots(c, equip))
return true;
else
return false;
}
public static boolean checkHelm(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(equip.getHelm(c.playerEquipment[c.playerHat]) == -1 ||
(c.playerEquipment[c.playerHat] == equip.getHelm(c.playerEquipment[c.playerHat]))) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
public static boolean checkBody(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(equip.getBody(c.playerEquipment[c.playerChest]) == -1 ||
(c.playerEquipment[c.playerChest] == equip.getBody(c.playerEquipment[c.playerChest]))) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
public static boolean checkLegs(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(equip.getLegs(c.playerEquipment[c.playerLegs]) == -1 ||
(c.playerEquipment[c.playerLegs] == equip.getLegs(c.playerEquipment[c.playerLegs]))) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
public static boolean checkWeapon(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(equip.getWeapon(c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon]) == -1 ||
(c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon] == equip.getWeapon(c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon]))) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
public static boolean checkShield(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(equip.getShield(c.playerEquipment[c.playerShield]) == -1 ||
(c.playerEquipment[c.playerShield] == equip.getShield(c.playerEquipment[c.playerShield]))) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
public static boolean checkBoots(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(equip.getBoot(c.playerEquipment[c.playerFeet]) == -1 ||
(c.playerEquipment[c.playerFeet] == equip.getBoot(c.playerEquipment[c.playerFeet]))) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
public static boolean checkHands(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(c.playerEquipment[c.playerHands] == equip.getHand(c.playerEquipment[c.playerHands])) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
}
}[/code]

The only code that is mine is I added some of the enums, and modified it to support all wear slots (I think).
Source: http://goo.gl/SDLjVPl (R-S seems to be down at the moment, sorry)
[/quote]
You should not be handling this with an enum. Load it externally.[/quote]
I don’t care how it should be done. How about you go write a god damn tutorial on how to load EVERYTHING EXTERNALLY since that’s all you bitch about.

Read full topic

item.title: PI armour level requirments
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:15, topic:538043”]Why does everyone ask that, “am I putting it in the right place”. It’s like no one knows that you could literally add any method to any class.
If you wanted to (while it would be inappropriate since this class isn’t for items) you could put your code in your chat packet. You can put code anywhere you please and it’d be okay. It’s frowned upon is because that is the worst possibly organization you could possibly do, and it may not be read correctly, but it could still be done.

So, to answer your question. Technically, yes, any class is the right spot.

However, I’d suggest looking into rewriting how your server handles item requirements…

I found a tutorial a long while back on making a different equipment check instead of the original one in PI, I’m sure with 2 minutes of work, you could add some form of stat requirement, or you could make a mock-up of this class and make it for level checks instead of just what you’re wearing.

[code=java]package server.model.players.equipment;

import server.model.players.Client;

public class CheckEquipment {

public final Client c;

public CheckEquipment(final Client Client) {
	c = Client;
}

public enum EquipmentData {
	ARHIMS_FULL(4716, 4720, 4722, 4718, -1, -1, -1),
	ARHIMS_100(4856, 4868, 4874, 4862, -1, -1, -1),
	ARHIMS_75(4857, 4869, 4875, 4863, -1, -1, -1),
	ARHIMS_50(4858, 4870, 4876, 4864, -1, -1, -1),
	ARHIMS_25(4859, 4871, 4877, 4865, -1, -1, -1),
	ARHIMS_0(4860, 4872, 4878, 4866, -1, -1, -1),

	DHAROKS_FULL(4708, 4712, 4714, 4710, -1, -1, -1),
	DHAROKS_100(4880, 4892, 4898, 4886, -1, -1, -1),
	DHAROKS_75(4881, 4893, 4899, 4887, -1, -1, -1),
	DHAROKS_50(4882, 4894, 4900, 4888, -1, -1, -1),
	DHAROKS_25(4883, 4895, 4901, 4889, -1, -1, -1),
	DHAROKS_0(4884, 4896, 4902, 4890, -1, -1, -1),
	
	GUTHANS_FULL(4724, 4728, 4730, 4726, -1, -1, -1),
	GUTHANS_100(4904, 4728, 4730, 4726, -1, -1, -1),
	GUTHANS_75(4905, 4916, 4922, 4910, -1, -1, -1),
	GUTHANS_50(4906, 4917, 4923, 4911, -1, -1, -1),
	GUTHANS_25(4907, 4918, 4924, 4912, -1, -1, -1),
	GUTHANS_0(4908, 4919, 4925, 4913, -1, -1, -1),
	
	KARILS_FULL(4732, 4736, 4738, 4734, -1, -1, -1),
	KARILS_100(4928, 4940, 4946, 4934, -1, -1, -1),
	KARILS_75(4929, 4941, 4947, 4935, -1, -1, -1),
	KARILS_50(4930, 4942, 4948, 4936, -1, -1, -1),
	KARILS_25(4931, 4943, 4949, 4937, -1, -1, -1),
	KARILS_0(4932, 4944, 4950, 4938, -1, -1, -1),
	
	TORAGS_FULL(4745, 4749, 4751, 4747, -1, -1, -1),
	TORAGS_100(4952, 4964, 4970, 4958, -1, -1, -1),
	TORAGS_75(4953, 4965, 4971, 4959, -1, -1, -1),
	TORAGS_50(4954, 4966, 4972, 4960, -1, -1, -1),
	TORAGS_25(4955, 4967, 4973, 4961, -1, -1, -1),
	TORAGS_0(4956, 4968, 4974, 4962, -1, -1, -1),
	
	VERACS_FULL(4753, 4757, 4759, 4755, -1, -1, -1),
	VERACS_100(4982, 4988, 4994, 4988, -1, -1, -1),
	VERACS_75(4983, 4989, 4995, 4989, -1, -1, -1),
	VERACS_50(4984, 4990, 4996, 4990, -1, -1, -1),
	VERACS_25(4985, 4991, 4997, 4991, -1, -1, -1),
	VERACS_0(4986, 4992, 4998, 4992, -1, -1, -1),
	
	VOID_MELEE(11665, 8839, 8840, -1, -1, 8842, -1),
	VOID_RANGE(11664, 8839, 8840, -1, -1, 8842, -1),
	VOID_MAGE(11663, 8839, 8840, -1, -1, 8842, -1)
	;

	private int helmId, bodyId, legId, weaponId, shieldId, handId, footId;
	
	private EquipmentData(int helmId, int bodyId, int legId, int weaponId, int shieldId, int handId, int footId) {
		this.helmId = helmId;
		this.bodyId = bodyId;
		this.legId = legId;
		this.weaponId = weaponId;
		this.shieldId = shieldId;
		this.handId = handId;
		this.footId = footId;
	}
	
	public int getHelm(int helm) {
		return helmId;
	}

	public int getBody(int body) {
		return bodyId;
	}

	public int getLegs(int leg) {
		return legId;
	}

	public int getWeapon(int weapon) {
		return weaponId;
	}
	
	public int getShield(int shield) {
		return shieldId;
	}
	public int getHand(int hand) {
		return handId;
	}
	public int getBoot(int boot) {
		return footId;
	}

/Checking for equipment, includes Full, Body, Legs, Helm, Weapon, and if not -1, Shield/
public static boolean checkFullEquipment(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(checkHelm(c, equip) && checkBody(c, equip) && checkLegs(c, equip) && checkWeapon(c, equip) &&
checkShield(c, equip) && checkHands(c, equip) && checkBoots(c, equip))
return true;
else
return false;
}
public static boolean checkHelm(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(equip.getHelm(c.playerEquipment[c.playerHat]) == -1 ||
(c.playerEquipment[c.playerHat] == equip.getHelm(c.playerEquipment[c.playerHat]))) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
public static boolean checkBody(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(equip.getBody(c.playerEquipment[c.playerChest]) == -1 ||
(c.playerEquipment[c.playerChest] == equip.getBody(c.playerEquipment[c.playerChest]))) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
public static boolean checkLegs(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(equip.getLegs(c.playerEquipment[c.playerLegs]) == -1 ||
(c.playerEquipment[c.playerLegs] == equip.getLegs(c.playerEquipment[c.playerLegs]))) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
public static boolean checkWeapon(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(equip.getWeapon(c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon]) == -1 ||
(c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon] == equip.getWeapon(c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon]))) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
public static boolean checkShield(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(equip.getShield(c.playerEquipment[c.playerShield]) == -1 ||
(c.playerEquipment[c.playerShield] == equip.getShield(c.playerEquipment[c.playerShield]))) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
public static boolean checkBoots(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(equip.getBoot(c.playerEquipment[c.playerFeet]) == -1 ||
(c.playerEquipment[c.playerFeet] == equip.getBoot(c.playerEquipment[c.playerFeet]))) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
public static boolean checkHands(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(c.playerEquipment[c.playerHands] == equip.getHand(c.playerEquipment[c.playerHands])) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
}
}[/code]

The only code that is mine is I added some of the enums, and modified it to support all wear slots (I think).
Source: http://goo.gl/SDLjVPl (R-S seems to be down at the moment, sorry)[/quote]
You should not be handling this with an enum. Load it externally.

item.title: PI armour level requirments
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Why does everyone ask that, “am I putting it in the right place”. It’s like no one knows that you could literally add any method to any class.
If you wanted to (while it would be inappropriate since this class isn’t for items) you could put your code in your chat packet. You can put code anywhere you please and it’d be okay. It’s frowned upon is because that is the worst possibly organization you could possibly do, and it may not be read correctly, but it could still be done.

So, to answer your question. Technically, yes, any class is the right spot.

However, I’d suggest looking into rewriting how your server handles item requirements…

I found a tutorial a long while back on making a different equipment check instead of the original one in PI, I’m sure with 2 minutes of work, you could add some form of stat requirement, or you could make a mock-up of this class and make it for level checks instead of just what you’re wearing.

[code=java]package server.model.players.equipment;

import server.model.players.Client;

public class CheckEquipment {

public final Client c;

public CheckEquipment(final Client Client) {
	c = Client;
}

public enum EquipmentData {
	ARHIMS_FULL(4716, 4720, 4722, 4718, -1, -1, -1),
	ARHIMS_100(4856, 4868, 4874, 4862, -1, -1, -1),
	ARHIMS_75(4857, 4869, 4875, 4863, -1, -1, -1),
	ARHIMS_50(4858, 4870, 4876, 4864, -1, -1, -1),
	ARHIMS_25(4859, 4871, 4877, 4865, -1, -1, -1),
	ARHIMS_0(4860, 4872, 4878, 4866, -1, -1, -1),

	DHAROKS_FULL(4708, 4712, 4714, 4710, -1, -1, -1),
	DHAROKS_100(4880, 4892, 4898, 4886, -1, -1, -1),
	DHAROKS_75(4881, 4893, 4899, 4887, -1, -1, -1),
	DHAROKS_50(4882, 4894, 4900, 4888, -1, -1, -1),
	DHAROKS_25(4883, 4895, 4901, 4889, -1, -1, -1),
	DHAROKS_0(4884, 4896, 4902, 4890, -1, -1, -1),
	
	GUTHANS_FULL(4724, 4728, 4730, 4726, -1, -1, -1),
	GUTHANS_100(4904, 4728, 4730, 4726, -1, -1, -1),
	GUTHANS_75(4905, 4916, 4922, 4910, -1, -1, -1),
	GUTHANS_50(4906, 4917, 4923, 4911, -1, -1, -1),
	GUTHANS_25(4907, 4918, 4924, 4912, -1, -1, -1),
	GUTHANS_0(4908, 4919, 4925, 4913, -1, -1, -1),
	
	KARILS_FULL(4732, 4736, 4738, 4734, -1, -1, -1),
	KARILS_100(4928, 4940, 4946, 4934, -1, -1, -1),
	KARILS_75(4929, 4941, 4947, 4935, -1, -1, -1),
	KARILS_50(4930, 4942, 4948, 4936, -1, -1, -1),
	KARILS_25(4931, 4943, 4949, 4937, -1, -1, -1),
	KARILS_0(4932, 4944, 4950, 4938, -1, -1, -1),
	
	TORAGS_FULL(4745, 4749, 4751, 4747, -1, -1, -1),
	TORAGS_100(4952, 4964, 4970, 4958, -1, -1, -1),
	TORAGS_75(4953, 4965, 4971, 4959, -1, -1, -1),
	TORAGS_50(4954, 4966, 4972, 4960, -1, -1, -1),
	TORAGS_25(4955, 4967, 4973, 4961, -1, -1, -1),
	TORAGS_0(4956, 4968, 4974, 4962, -1, -1, -1),
	
	VERACS_FULL(4753, 4757, 4759, 4755, -1, -1, -1),
	VERACS_100(4982, 4988, 4994, 4988, -1, -1, -1),
	VERACS_75(4983, 4989, 4995, 4989, -1, -1, -1),
	VERACS_50(4984, 4990, 4996, 4990, -1, -1, -1),
	VERACS_25(4985, 4991, 4997, 4991, -1, -1, -1),
	VERACS_0(4986, 4992, 4998, 4992, -1, -1, -1),
	
	VOID_MELEE(11665, 8839, 8840, -1, -1, 8842, -1),
	VOID_RANGE(11664, 8839, 8840, -1, -1, 8842, -1),
	VOID_MAGE(11663, 8839, 8840, -1, -1, 8842, -1)
	;

	private int helmId, bodyId, legId, weaponId, shieldId, handId, footId;
	
	private EquipmentData(int helmId, int bodyId, int legId, int weaponId, int shieldId, int handId, int footId) {
		this.helmId = helmId;
		this.bodyId = bodyId;
		this.legId = legId;
		this.weaponId = weaponId;
		this.shieldId = shieldId;
		this.handId = handId;
		this.footId = footId;
	}
	
	public int getHelm(int helm) {
		return helmId;
	}

	public int getBody(int body) {
		return bodyId;
	}

	public int getLegs(int leg) {
		return legId;
	}

	public int getWeapon(int weapon) {
		return weaponId;
	}
	
	public int getShield(int shield) {
		return shieldId;
	}
	public int getHand(int hand) {
		return handId;
	}
	public int getBoot(int boot) {
		return footId;
	}

/Checking for equipment, includes Full, Body, Legs, Helm, Weapon, and if not -1, Shield/
public static boolean checkFullEquipment(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(checkHelm(c, equip) && checkBody(c, equip) && checkLegs(c, equip) && checkWeapon(c, equip) &&
checkShield(c, equip) && checkHands(c, equip) && checkBoots(c, equip))
return true;
else
return false;
}
public static boolean checkHelm(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(equip.getHelm(c.playerEquipment[c.playerHat]) == -1 ||
(c.playerEquipment[c.playerHat] == equip.getHelm(c.playerEquipment[c.playerHat]))) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
public static boolean checkBody(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(equip.getBody(c.playerEquipment[c.playerChest]) == -1 ||
(c.playerEquipment[c.playerChest] == equip.getBody(c.playerEquipment[c.playerChest]))) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
public static boolean checkLegs(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(equip.getLegs(c.playerEquipment[c.playerLegs]) == -1 ||
(c.playerEquipment[c.playerLegs] == equip.getLegs(c.playerEquipment[c.playerLegs]))) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
public static boolean checkWeapon(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(equip.getWeapon(c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon]) == -1 ||
(c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon] == equip.getWeapon(c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon]))) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
public static boolean checkShield(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(equip.getShield(c.playerEquipment[c.playerShield]) == -1 ||
(c.playerEquipment[c.playerShield] == equip.getShield(c.playerEquipment[c.playerShield]))) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
public static boolean checkBoots(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(equip.getBoot(c.playerEquipment[c.playerFeet]) == -1 ||
(c.playerEquipment[c.playerFeet] == equip.getBoot(c.playerEquipment[c.playerFeet]))) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
public static boolean checkHands(Client c, EquipmentData equip) {
if(c.playerEquipment[c.playerHands] == equip.getHand(c.playerEquipment[c.playerHands])) {
return true;
}
return false;
}
}
}[/code]

The only code that is mine is I added some of the enums, and modified it to support all wear slots (I think).

Try adding the part where you check for the second part of the name (platebody, shield, etc) where the other rune check is (the one where the knife and all that is). Since that one already checks for the name “rune” you might as well add another if statement in it.

item.title: PI armour level requirments
item.dc:creator: @supermimez supermimez
item.description:
@supermimez wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:8, topic:538043”]Guys, are you all blind?
Read his code
It says:
if(!itemName.contains(“platebody”)

So the stat req of any item with “rune” and “platebody” in it doesn’t do anything…
Edit:

OP use this:

if (itemName.contains("rune")) { if(itemName.contains("platebody") || itemName.contains("shield") || itemName.contains("platelegs") || itemName.contains("kite") || itemName.contains("helm")) { c.defenceLevelReq = 40; }[/quote]
that still didnt work… I added it in ItemAssistant where all the other requirments are. So, Im a bit confused why nothin is working.
Edit: But when I click on a rune weapon it says that I need 40 attack to wield…So armor doesn’t work but weapons do.

item.title: PI armour level requirments
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

supermimez:

that didnt work because I got errors, so how do you add it externally?

write the data in raw text or json (fastest) and parse the data when the server starts, then you can use the parsed data to easily determine which items need which level to be able to be equipped

Read full topic

item.title: PI armour level requirments
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

supermimez:

that didnt work because I got errors, so how do you add it externally?

You probably put it in the wrong place, make sure you put it in your wearItem packet or you can put it in your clickItem class too either or would work I guess.

Loading them externally means loading data from a file that isn’t java. I recommend looking some tutorials up before doing this because it will be pretty complicated at the beginning

Read full topic

item.title: PI armour level requirments
item.dc:creator: @supermimez supermimez
item.description:

that didnt work because I got errors, so how do you add it externally?

item.title: PI armour level requirments
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

[quote=“supermimez, post:3, topic:538043”]i added that[quote author=DAn0194 link=topic=656869.msg4394781#msg4394781 date=1388786757]
if (itemName.contains("rune") { c.defenceLevelReq = 40; }
[/quote]but it didnt do anything…[/quote]

Okay in your wear item packet.

Add this:

if(wearId == RUNE_ID && playerLevel[defence] < 40) { c.sM("You need to be 40 defence to wear rune armour"); return; }

Still, I highly recommend that you load these things externally because it is going to get very messy.

Read full topic

item.title: PI armour level requirments
item.dc:creator: @supermimez supermimez
item.description:
